com.mapbox.services.android.navigation.v5

Class MapboxNavigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapbox.services.android.navigation.v5.MapboxNavigation

extends Object
    This is an experimental API. Experimental APIs are quickly evolving and might change or be removed in minor versions.

    2.0.0

    • Method Detail

      • onStart

        public void onStart()
        It's required to include both the onStop and onStart inside your navigation activities identically named lifecycle methods.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • onStop

        public void onStop()
        It's required to include both the onStop and onStart inside your navigation activities identically named lifecycle methods.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • onDestroy

        public void onDestroy()

      • setLocationEngine

        public void setLocationEngine(com.mapbox.services.android.telemetry.location.LocationEngine locationEngine)
        Before starting a navigationService, it is required to setup a LocationEngine and pass it into your instance of MapboxNavigation. If a locationEngine isn't provided, one will be created.
        Parameters:
        locationEngine - A LocationEngine used for the navigation session.

      • setNavigationEventListener

        public void setNavigationEventListener(NavigationEventListener navigationEventListener)
        Optionally listen into when a new navigation event occurs. This listener can be used to listen into when the navigation service is running in the background or not.
        Parameters:
        navigationEventListener - a new NavigationEventListener which will be notified when navigation events occur.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • setAlertLevelChangeListener

        public void setAlertLevelChangeListener(AlertLevelChangeListener alertLevelChangeListener)
        Optionally, setup a alert change listener which will be notified when the user reaches a particular part of the route. This listener is good for notifying your user they need to perform a new action.
        Parameters:
        alertLevelChangeListener - a new AlertLevelChangeListener which will be notified when event occurs.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • setProgressChangeListener

        public void setProgressChangeListener(ProgressChangeListener progressChangeListener)
        Optionally, setup a progress change listener to be notified each time the users location has changed. For more details see ProgressChangeListener.
        Parameters:
        progressChangeListener - a new ProgressChangeListener which will be notified when event occurs.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • setOffRouteListener

        public void setOffRouteListener(OffRouteListener offRouteListener)

      • setSnapToRoute

        public void setSnapToRoute(boolean snapToRoute)
        Disable or enable the snap to route for navigation, by default this is set to enable. When enabled, the snap to route functionality of this SDK takes place and the user will snap to the route if the user is currently along the route giving a better user experience. It's recommend to leave this enabled. Otherwise, the location used for Navigation will be the actual GPS location which will typically be noisy and not follow the route.
        Parameters:
        snapToRoute - boolean true if you'd like snap to route be enabled, else false; defaults true.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • startNavigation

        public void startNavigation(com.mapbox.services.api.directions.v5.models.DirectionsRoute route)
        Call startNavigation passing in a DirectionsRoute object to begin a navigation session. It is recommend to call getRoute(Callback) before starting a navigation session.
        Parameters:
        route - A DirectionsRoute that makes up the path your user will traverse along.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • endNavigation

        public void endNavigation()
        Call this method to end a navigation session before the user reaches their destination. There isn't a need to call this once the user reaches their destination. You can use the setAlertLevelChangeListener(AlertLevelChangeListener) to be notified when the user arrives at their location.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • setupNotification

        public void setupNotification(Activity activity)
        Optionally, set up navigation notification using the default builder provided in the SDK. Alternatively, you can create your own notifications by using the setAlertLevelChangeListener(AlertLevelChangeListener) to correctly time your notifications.
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity being used for the navigation session.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • getRoute

        public void getRoute(@NonNull
                     retrofit2.Callback<com.mapbox.services.api.directions.v5.models.DirectionsResponse> callback)
              throws com.mapbox.services.api.ServicesException
        Request navigation to acquire a route and notify your callback when a response comes in. A ServicesException will be thrown if you haven't set your access token, origin or destination before calling getRoute.
        Parameters:
        callback - A callback of type DirectionsResponse which allows you to handle the Directions API response.
        Throws:
        com.mapbox.services.api.ServicesException
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • getOrigin

        public com.mapbox.services.commons.models.Position getOrigin()
        Get the current origin Position that will be used for the beginning of the route. If no origin's provided, null will be returned. An origin must be provided before calling getRoute(Callback).
        Returns:
        A Position object representing the origin of your route.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • setOrigin

        public void setOrigin(@NonNull
                      com.mapbox.services.commons.models.Position origin)
        Set the origin that will be used for the beginning of the route. This will be used once getRoute(Callback)'s called.
        Parameters:
        origin - A Position representing the origin of your route.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • getDestination

        public com.mapbox.services.commons.models.Position getDestination()
        Get the current destination Position that will be used for the end of the route. If no destinations's provided, null will be returned. A destination must be provided before calling getRoute(Callback).
        Returns:
        A Position object representing the destination of your route.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • setDestination

        public void setDestination(@NonNull
                           com.mapbox.services.commons.models.Position destination)
        Set the destination that will be used for the end of the route. This will be used once getRoute(Callback)'s called.
        Parameters:
        destination - A Position representing the destination of your route.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • setUserOriginBearing

        public void setUserOriginBearing(int userBearing)
        Optional but recommended parameter that can be used to route a user in the correct orientation they are already headed in. This will help prevent routing the user to begin the route by performing an illegal U-turn.
        Parameters:
        userBearing - int between 0 and 260 representing the users current bearing.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • getUserOriginBearing

        public int getUserOriginBearing()
        Gets the current user bearing that will be used when getRoute(Callback)'s called. If no value's set, the return value will be null.
        Returns:
        A value between 0 and 360 or null if the userOriginBearing hasn't been set.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • setConsiderTraffic

        public void setConsiderTraffic(boolean disableTraffic)
        Calling this passing in true will change the default profile used when requesting your route to not consider traffic when routing. For more accurate timing and ensuring the quickest routes provided to the user, it isn't recommend to disable traffic. It is good if you are looking to reproduce the same route over and over for testing for example.
        Since:
        2.0.0
